text:
Hi,
Is log-uniform sampling for tuning with `RandomSearch` supported? E.g., for tuning a regularization parameter between `1e-5` and `1e-1`. The `scale` parameter for `range(...)` doesn't seem to have an effect with `RandomSearch` and on top of that, it doesn't look like Distributions.jl even *has* a log-uniform or reciprocal distribution, so it feels like I'm missing something here.

text:
The `RandomSearch` tuning strategy when used with `NumericRange` 's  should be able to work with any given  `distribution::UnivariateDistribution`  from <https://github.com/JuliaStats/Distributions.jl|Distributions.jl> package, provided `minumum(::UnivariateDistribution)` , `maximum(::UnivariateDistribution)` and `rand(rng::AbstractRNG,  ::UnivariteDistribution)`  methods exist for the given `distribution`  in addition to other methods. At the moment <https://github.com/JuliaStats/Distributions.jl|Distributions.jl> doesn't implement the `LogUniform` distribution. So  you can either open an issue at <https://github.com/JuliaStats/Distributions.jl|Distributions.jl>  requesting this distribution or implement one yourself. See <https://juliastats.org/Distributions.jl/stable/extends/|here> for details.

Yes  if the  `scale` parameter  in  `range(...)`  isn't an instance of type `Base.Callable` it won't have any effect when tuning with `RandomSearch`  strategy.
